article_text:
The Sunsphere, with Mount LeConte in the distance, is pictured Wednesday, Nov. 19, 2014. Fort Sanders Regional Medical Center is at right. (PAUL EFIRD/NEWS SENTINEL)

FESTIVALS

Winter Angel Expo Car Show and Swap Meet: Saturday, Jan. 16-Sunday, Jan. 17, at Walters State Community College Smokey Mountain Expo Center in White Pine. Hamblen County Car Club organizes the event. Opportunities for both indoor and outdoor vendors. Cost: indoor vendors: $45, outdoor: $35, entry fee: $30. Info: http://winterangelexpocarshow.com.

MUSIC

Winter Indoor Drum Circle: 3:30-5 p.m. Sunday, Jan. 17, at Ijams Nature Center. Shake off the winter blues by drumming inside the Miller Building. All ages welcome. Bring a drum or share one of ours. Free. Register at 865-577-4717, ext. 110.

"Hansel and Gretel Opera by Humperdinck": 11 a.m. Saturday, Jan. 16, in the Blount County Library Main Gallery. Will be performed as a full opera by the Knoxville Opera Company under the direction of Brian Salesky, conductor and executive director. Info: 865-982-0981 or 865-273-1436.

Tennessee Valley Ensemble Community Band: 6:30 p.m. Tuesday, Jan. 12, at Peace Lutheran Church, 621 N. Cedar Bluff Road. A get-acquainted potluck dinner followed by rehearsal for wind and percussion instrumentalists interested in joining the group. Regular rehearsals are 7-8:30 p.m. Tuesdays. Info: Director Sandy Wells 865-659-0840 or www.tnvalleyensemble.org.

Family Concert featuring Oak Ridge Symphony Orchestra: 3 p.m. Sunday, Jan. 24, with 2 p.m. pre-concert activities at Oak Ridge High School Performing Arts Center. Presented by Oak Ridge Civic Music Association. Free.

Knoxville Symphony Orchestra Beethoven & Bruch: 7:30 p.m. Thursday, Jan. 21, and Friday, Jan. 22. at Tennessee Theatre, 604 S. Gay St. Part of KSO Moxley Carmichael Masterworks Series. $13 to $83 for adult, $11 for student Info: 865-291-3310, www.knoxvillesymphony.com.

THEATER

"Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat": 8 p.m. Friday, Jan. 15, 2 and 7 p.m. Saturday, Jan. 16, at Tennessee Theatre, 604 S. Gay St. Part of "Broadway at the Tennessee" $37, $67 and $77 Info: 865-684-1200, www.tennesseetheatre.com.

Shen Yun: 7:30 p.m. Tuesday, Jan. 12, and Wednesday, Jan. 13, at Tennessee Theatre, 604 S. Gay St. $62, $82, $102, $122, $152 Info: www.tennesseetheatre.com.

AUDITIONS

"Clybourne Park": 6:30-8:30 p.m. Monday, Jan. 18, and Tuesday, Jan. 19, at 404 Wharf St., Loudon. By Lyric Theatre. Casting for white males age 40-50, age 20-30 and age in 30s, white female age 40-50 and 20-30, black female and black male ages 30-50. Info: 865-740-5711.

Visual Arts

"Represent: Explorations in Realism, Image and Illusion": 10 a.m.-6:30 p.m. weekdays Tuesday, Jan. 19,-Friday, Feb. 5, at Bagwell Center Gallery, Bagwell Center for Media and Art, Pellissippi State Community College, 10915 Hardin Valley Road. Free. Info: 865-694-6405, www.pstcc.edu/arts.

Paintings by Hannah Harper: 11 a.m.-7 p.m. Thursday-Saturday, 11 a.m.-3 p.m. Sunday through Tuesday, Feb. 2, at Broadway Studios and Gallery, 1127 N. Broadway. Free. Info: www.BroadwayStudiosAndGallery.com.

BOOKS/WRITERS

Blount County Library Pre-owned Book Sale: Noon-6 p.m. Thursday, Jan. 21, is members only sale. 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Friday, Jan. 22-Sunday, Jan. 23, is open to public. $1 for soft cover and $2.50 for hard cover, plus movies, audiobooks, specially priced rare books, collectibles and more. Info: 865-982-0981 or 865-273-1436.

Staged Reading of "Last Train to Nibroc" by Arlene Hutton: 7:30 p.m. Monday, Jan. 11, at the Square Room. Sponsored by the Word Players. Doors open at 7 p.m. Free. Info: www.wordplayers.org.

Sundress Academy for the Arts Reading Series Event: 3 p.m. Sunday, Jan. 10, at Lawson McGhee Library, 500 W. Church Ave. Visiting poet George David Clark and local writer and editor Jeni Wallace will speak. Free. Open to public. Info: www.sundressacademyforthearts.com.

Friends of the Knox County Public Library Winter Bag Sale: Fill a bag of books of your choice for $5 at Rothrock Used Book Shop during the month of January. Rothrock is open daily at Lawson McGhee Library. Info: visit www.knoxfriends.org or call 865-215-8775.

LECTURES/DISCUSSION

"The Origins of Chinese Poetry": 3:30 p.m. Thursday, Jan. 14, in the Lindsay Young Auditorium of John C. Hodges Library, 1015 Volunteer Blvd. By Princeton Professor Martin Kern. Free and open to the public. Info: http://uthumanitiesctr.utk.edu/current.php.

"An Inside Look at Lloyd Branson": Noon. Wednesday, Jan. 13, at the East Tennessee History Center. By Adam Alfrey, exhibits curator for the center. Free. Attendees encouraged to bring a brown bag lunch. Info: 865-215-8824 or www.EastTNHistory.org.

Humanities Center Conversations and Cocktails: 6-7:30 p.m. Tuesday, Jan. 12, at The Grill at Highlands Row, 4705 Old Kingston Pike, Knoxville. "'That's What You Think': James Agee as Movie Reviewer." Dinner reservations required at 865-694-1600. Seating is limited. Info: 865-851-7722.

Knoxville Civil War Roundtable Dinner and Lecture: Tuesday, Jan. 12, at Bearden Banquet Hall. "The Civil War on the Cumberland Plateau" Aaron Astor, Maryville College assistant professor and author. Dinner at 7 p.m. Lecture at 8 p.m. Cost: dinner and lecture for members: $15, nonmembers: $17, lecture only for members: $3, nonmembers: $5. RSVP by 11 a.m. Monday, Jan. 11, at 865-671-9001.

CLASSES/WORKSHOPS

"It's Your Career, Effective Communication": 8-10 a.m. Friday, Jan. 15, at the Blount County Public Library. Taught by Adult Education instructors in the Computer Lab. Class synopsis and registration information: Amy Lawson at 865-983-2241 or www.blountchamber.com/community/soft-skills.

AAA Driver Improvement Course, 4 hours: 5:30-9:30 p.m. Thursday, Jan. 14, at AAA Downtown Knoxville office. Helps reduce points for traffic offenders and teaches how to reduce risk while driving. Cost: $30 members/$35 non-members. Must pre-register. Info: Kate, 865-862-9254 or Stephanie, 865-862-9252.

AAA Driver Improvement Course, 8 hours: 8 a.m.-4:30 p.m. Saturday, Jan. 16, at AAA Downtown Knoxville office. Helps reduce points for traffic offenders and teaches how to reduce risk while driving. Cost: $40 members/$50 non-members. Must pre-register. Info: Kate, 865-862-9254 or Stephanie, 865-862-9252.

Reflections, Light and Magic Art Classes: 10 a.m.-1 p.m. Tuesdays, Jan. 12, 19, 26 and Feb. 2, 9 and 16, at the Knoxville Museum of Art. Instructor Bobbie Crews. Cost: members $150, non-members $175. Info, registration and materials list: www.knoxart.org.

Monthly Model Railroad Class Series: First class at 9 a.m. Saturday, Jan. 16, at the Crossville Outlet Center. The January class will cover model railroad design and rolling stock. Future classes will include basic wiring, railroad operation and weathering. Free. Space limited. Info and registration: call 931-210-5050 noon-4 p.m. Tuesday-Sunday and 11 a.m.-4 p.m. Saturdays.

HEALTH

Fruits and Veggies Bingo: 11:30 a.m. Monday, Jan. 11, at the Humana Guidance Center, 640 Plaza, 4438 Western Ave. Free. Bring fruits and veggies as prizes. Info: 865-329-8892.

Complementary Health Education Organization: 6:30 p.m. Monday, Jan. 11, Classroom No. 1, Parkwest Physicians Plaza, 9330 Park West Blvd. Chiropractor Dr. Kate Flynn to present "Becoming Who You Were Meant To Be." Info: 865-617-7292; www.CHEOknox.org

Nutrition Ammunition — "Nutritional Resolutions" for people with cancer: Noon-1:30pm Tuesday, Jan. 12, Cancer Support Community, 2230 Sutherland Ave. Free; light lunch provided. Register: 865-546-4661.

Leukemia, Lymphoma and Myeloma Networker: 6-7:30 p.m. Thursday, Jan. 14, Cancer Support Community, 2230 Sutherland Ave. Info: 865-546-4661.

"Navigating Through Life Transitions": 10:30 a.m. Saturday, Jan. 16, Grace Lutheran Church, 131 W. Gettysburg Ave., Oak Ridge. Certified grief counselor Stephen Herbes to speak. Free; child care provided. Info: 865-483-3787.

Affordable Care Act insurance marketplace enrollment assistance: 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Saturday, Jan. 16, Blount County Public Library, Maryville. Advisers will provide one-on-one assistance by appointment. Appointments: 844-644-5443; www.getcoveredtenn.org/commit.

PK Hope is Alive Parkinson's self-help group: 11:30 a.m.-1:30 p.m. Tuesday, Jan. 19, Kern United Methodist Church Fmaily Life Center, 451 E. Tennessee Ave., Oak Ridge. Registered dietitian Angie Tillman to speak. Info: Karen Sampsell, 865-482-4867; www.pkhopeisalive.org.

MISC.

"Symphony of the Soil" Screening: 2 p.m. Sunday, Jan. 17, at UT's Hollingsworth Auditorium, 2431 Joe Johnson Drive. Documentary film by Deborah Koons Garcia. Cost: $5. Concessions available. UT Soil Science professor will lead a Q&A session after the screening. Register for the event at https://utgardens.wildapricot.org/event-2117259.

Panther Creek State Park Trout Lily Trail Hike: Noon. Saturday, Jan. 16. Will begin at the park's boat ramp. Two-mile hike. Wear sturdy shoes and bring water. Info: 423-587-7046.

Gold Anniversary Showing of "Au Hasard Balthazar": 7 p.m. Friday, Jan. 15, at Eclectic Vibe Centre, 560 Monroe St., Madisonville. Directed by Robert Bresson, the French film tells the story of a donkey whose changing circumstances represent each of the seven deadly sins. Free. Refreshments and discussion after. Metal chairs provided, but attendees can bring their own seating. Info: 423-545-9289.

CLUBS

Ossoli Circle Club Meeting: Monday, Jan. 11, at the clubhouse. 9:45 a.m. Fellowship. 10:30 a.m. "History of Elkmont" by Dan Paulin. 11:30 a.m. Child Help, USA, by Pamela Dickey. 12:30 p.m. Lunch, Bridge and orientation for new members.

Laureate Alpha Gamma Chapter of Beta Sigma Phi: 6:30 p.m. Tuesday, Jan. 12, at the Chapter House, 1411 Armstrong Ave. Sheila Sharp will present program on history and development of Norris Dam. 865-689-2581.

Newcomers Club Meeting: Noon. Wednesday, Jan. 20, at Bearden Banquet Hall. Ladies new to the area or who want to make new friends are welcome. Lindsey Hensley will speak about the American Heart Association 'Go Red' for Women. RSVP at 865-985-0521 by Jan. 15.

Heiskell Community Center Monthly Seniors Meeting: 10 a.m.-2 p.m. Thursday, Jan. 14, at the center. Speaker will be John Whitehead. If inclement weather (Knox Co. schools out), the program will be canceled. Bring a dessert and a friend. Info: Janice White, 865-548-0326.

Knoxville Miniature Society: 10 a.m. Thursday, Jan. 14, at Westminister Presbyterian Church, 6500 Northshore Drive. Info: 865 458 8087.

Society of Military Engineers East Tennessee Technology Corridor Monthly Chapter Meeting: Tuesday, Jan. 12, at Riverside Grille, Oak Ridge. 11:30 a.m.-noon, lunch. Noon-1 p.m., meeting. Cost: (cash only) members: $20, young members, government employees and retirees: $15, non-members: $25. RSVP to mary.mcdermott@jacobs.com or 865-220-4119.

Military Officers Association of America, East Tennessee Chapter: 11:45 a.m. Friday, Jan. 15, at Olive Garden Restaurant, 7206 Kingston Pike. Program on the Tennessee Emergency Management Agency. Call Maj. Bill Potter, USAF/Ret., at 865-254-9218 to RSVP.

Hiwassee chapter SAR: 6:30 p.m. Monday, Jan. 11, at Western Sizzlin Restaurant. SAR compatriot Donald Edmands will speak on "George Washington as Head of the Country." New officers for 2016 will be installed after the program by State President Darryl Addington.

Smoky Mountains Hiking Club Laurel Falls/Cove Mountain Hike: Meet at 8 a.m. Saturday, Jan. 16, at Alcoa Food City. Twelve-mile hike. Rated moderate. Leaders: Mary Brewer, emiebrewer@gmail.com, and David Smith, dcshiker@bellsouth.net.

Harvey Broome Group, Sierra Club Program: 7 p.m. Tuesday, Jan. 12, at the Tennessee Valley Unitarian Universalist Church. Ultra-light backpacking presented by Bryan Delay. Free. Open to public. Info: Mac Post, mpost3116@aol.com or 865-806-0980.

Knoxville Christian Women's Connection Renewing Your Body and Soul Luncheon: 10:45 a.m. Thursday, Jan. 14, at Buddy's Bearden Banquet Hall, 5806 Kingston Pike. Attendees should wear warm up suits or dress casual for a light work out with music. Cindy Leihkauff will share her story on being "An Unlikely Princess." Complimentary child care by reservation only. Cost: $12. RSVP to 865-315-8182 or email knoxvillechristianwomen@gmail.com.

Military Order of the World Wars: 11 a.m. Wednesday, Jan. 13, at Rothchilds Catering and Conference Center, 8807 Kingston Pike. Active duty, retired and former military officers invited for lunch and monthly meeting. Spouses welcome. Info: 865-690-2180.

University of Alabama Alumni Association, East Tennessee Chapter: Lunch and meeting. 11 a.m. Friday, Jan. 15, at Cherokee Country Club, 5138 Lyons View Pike. Info: ETUAKnox@gmail.com and bbala1970@aol.com.

Air Force Sergeants Association Chapter No. 479 Monthly Meeting: 5 p.m. Thursday, Jan. 14, Puleo's Alcoa. RSVP to President Colin Mike Gates at 865-640-5937 or email AFSA479@gmail.com.

Ellen Renshaw House, Chapter 2624, UDC Military Service Award Ceremony 2:30 p.m. Sunday, Jan. 17, at Crescent Bend, 2728 Kingston Pike.

Wild Ones, Smoky Mountain Chapter: 6:30 p.m. Thursday, Jan. 14, at the Citizens National Bank, Route 66 3014 Winfield Dunn Parkway. Presentation on the Native Plant Rescue Squad by founders Gerry Moll and Joy Grissom. Business meeting will follow. Info: Leo H. Lubke, chapter president, at LHLubke@aol.com.

Bonny Kate Chapter DAR: 1 p.m. Wednesday, Jan. 13, at Second Presbyterian Church, 2829 Kingston Pike. Karen Smith from Children's Hospital will speak on "Project Adam." Info: Joyce Condry, 865-573-1116.

Captain W.Y.C. Hannum UDC Robert E Lee Luncheon: 10:30 a.m. Saturday, Jan. 16, at Monte Vista Baptist Church in Maryville. Rev. Clarence Gresham from Southside Baptist Church will speak. Lunch will be served. RSVP to President Shirley Rouse at 865-531-1467.

Andrew Bogle Chapter DAR: 10:30 a.m. Wednesday, Jan. 13, at Bearden Banquet Hall. Program on Genealogy by Dr. Dennis West, plant science professor, University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Info: 865-690-3097.

Mary Blount Chapter DAR: 2 p.m. Tuesday, Jan. 12, at the Blount County Library, Sharon Lawson Room. Ron Jones will introduce his new book about the American Revolution. Info: Pat Reilly, 865-379-5584.

Garden Clubs

West Hills 10 O'clock Gardeners: will meet at 9:30 a.m. Thursday, Jan. 14, at Shiloh Condos Clubhouse, 126 Confederacy Circle. Master gardener June Zachary will discuss herbs.

og.description: Car Show and Swap Meet, theater, music, visual arts and much more coming up.
og.title: Things-to-do Calendar through Jan. 17

twitter.description: Car Show and Swap Meet, theater, music, visual arts and much more coming up.
twitter.title: Things-to-do Calendar through Jan. 17

article_summary:
Staged Reading of "Last Train to Nibroc" by Arlene Hutton: 7:30 p.m. Monday, Jan. 11, at the Square Room.
Hannum UDC Robert E Lee Luncheon: 10:30 a.m. Saturday, Jan. 16, at Monte Vista Baptist Church in Maryville.
Shen Yun: 7:30 p.m. Tuesday, Jan. 12, and Wednesday, Jan. 13, at Tennessee Theatre, 604 S. Gay St. $62, $82, $102, $122, $152 Info: www.tennesseetheatre.com.
Smoky Mountains Hiking Club Laurel Falls/Cove Mountain Hike: Meet at 8 a.m. Saturday, Jan. 16, at Alcoa Food City.
"Navigating Through Life Transitions": 10:30 a.m. Saturday, Jan. 16, Grace Lutheran Church, 131 W. Gettysburg Ave., Oak Ridge.
